intro: Schoenus hexander, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a perennial wetland plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and spikes of small, pale brown flowers. It typically grows in shallow, freshwater wetlands and is often found in swampy areas or along the edges of lakes and rivers. Schoenus hexander plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
